summary.p: 108 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: R. 11; Text: Q 23:5-Q 25:20; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 280 x 198 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 6-7: "20 R. 11 Kur’an’dan bir bölüm Parşömen. 198mm boy ve 280mm eninde cönk şeklinde 108 yaprak. Sahifede iri kûfî yazı ile 185mm uzunl.[uğunda] 5 satır. Tahminen II - III. (VIII - IX) asırda kopya edilmiştir. Bu cüzlerin Hz. ʿAlī b. abī Ṭalib’e isnad edildiği yazılıdır. Bazı yapraklarını kurt yemiş, ve bazıları tamir edilmiştir. Miklepli vişneçürüğü deri cilt. Bu ciltte Mu’minūn (23) suresinin 5. ayetinin حافظون kelimesinden Furḳān (25) suresinin 25. ayetinin وجعلنا بعضكم لبعض فتنة ...cümlesine kadardır."

This can be translated as follows: "20 R. 11 A part of the Qurʾān Parchment. 108 junk shaped leaves of 198 mm height and 280 mm width. The text area, written in large Kufic script [contains] 5 lines measuring 185 mm. Probably copied during the 2nd-3rd [(8th-9th)] centuries. It is written that these parts are attributed to ʿAlī b. abī Ṭalib. Some leaves are worm-eaten and some of them have been repaired. Cherry brown leather binding with flap (miklep). The fragment begins with the word حافظون of Q 23:5 (Sūra al- Muʾminūn) and ends with the words of وجعلنا بعضكم لبعض فتنة ...Q 25:25 [sic!] (Sūra al-Furqān)."
